text: I'm now on a walk back from the studio to my house walking along the Rote which is the river that Waterdam has its name from and we are fortunate to have a view of it and I'm kind of almost seeing a setting sun it's already set behind the buildings on the other side of the river but it creates this beautiful gradient from very light orange to pinkish to blue with these fluffy almost cliche pink clouds very good so thinking about loops I first thought like do I even have circles or loops I thought of walks and how I often take the same walk back to my house even though I couldn't also walk on the other side of the water and then I was thinking is that actually a loop or is it just back and forth but for some reason it actually does feel like a loop because I walk the same streets but it's not the same streets it's a different moment not just because you never walk the same street twice but it's kind of a loop in time and that's the way there in the morning and the way back in the afternoon and then the next day again so it's a loop that kind of overlaps in place but it's this person time if that makes sense but also I've had this thought that loops and circles sometimes a bit scary look no progress no change stuck in a groundhog day and I thought of this huge loop that my my life made when I was born well I was born in Eindhoven and then I started on a journey studying first in another place in the Netherlands and then way further in Vancouver and I really enjoyed it really enjoyed living somewhere else exploring new worlds but then when I was looking for a next place to go I was looking for something that would look combined my interest in philosophy in design and I was looking the States in Canada Scandinavia in England didn't really know and then I ended up applying for design Academy Eindhoven and I found myself after being almost across the globe moving back to the city where I was born and I really felt like what is this strange loop why how did I end up here again but for my precious life has programmed me to now be back and still haven't really found it if there's this this magical answer I don't know but now I'm away from Eindhoven again so it wasn't a loop where I got stuck it was just a loop and I actually don't think I hate loops that much anymore fear them it's more like minimum music you can go back but then you can also go away again the loops can change loudly Eindhoven was quite different when I came back and now I live in Rotterdam and to be fair it looped back to Eindhoven again and again when I teach and people ask me where can you have a nice dinner and I don't know because I know it's different every time I go there it's maybe also what I like about the studio walk or my run across the water is that every time I take the same route I meet the worlds where it is at that point and I meet myself where I am at that point in the worlds and inside

segments.text: I'm now on a walk back from the studio to my house. I'm walking along the Rotte which is the
river that Rotterdam has its name from and we are fortunate to have a view of it and
I'm kind of almost seeing a setting sun it's already set behind the buildings on the other
side of the river but it creates this beautiful gradient from very light orange to pinkish
to blue with these fluffy almost cliche pink clouds very good so thinking about loops I
first thought like do I even have circles or loops I thought of walks and how I often
take the same walk back to my house even though I couldn't also walk on the other side of the
water and then I was thinking is that actually a loop or is it just back and forth but for some
reason it actually does feel like a loop because I walk the same streets but it's not the same
streets it's a different moment not just because you never walk the same street twice but it's
kind of a loop in time and that's the way there in the morning and the way back in the afternoon
and then the next day again so it's a loop that kind of overlaps in place but it's this person
time if that makes sense but also I've had this thought that loops and circles sometimes a bit
scary look no progress no change stuck in a groundhog day and I thought of this huge loop that
my my life made when I was born well I was born in Eindhoven and then I started on a journey
studying first in another place in the Netherlands and then way further in Vancouver and I really
enjoyed it really enjoyed living somewhere else exploring new worlds but then when I was looking
for a next place to go I was looking for something that would look combined my interest in philosophy
in design and I was looking the States in Canada Scandinavia in England didn't really know and then
I ended up applying for design Academy Eindhoven and I found myself after being almost across the
globe moving back to the city where I was born and I really felt like what is this strange loop
why how did I end up here again but for my precious life has programmed me to now be back
and still haven't really found it if there's this this magical answer I don't know but
now I'm away from Eindhoven again so it wasn't a loop where I got stuck it was just a loop
and I actually don't think I hate loops that much anymore fear them it's more like minimum music
you can go back but then you can also go away again the loops can change loudly Eindhoven was
quite different when I came back and now I live in Rotterdam and to be fair it looped back to
Eindhoven again and again when I teach and people ask me where can you have a nice dinner and I
don't know because I know it's different every time I go there it's maybe also what I like about
the studio walk or my run across the water is that every time I take the same route I meet the
worlds where it is at that point and I meet myself where I am at that point in the worlds and inside
